job_description: Software Engineer - Embedded - job post REV Robotics Carrollton, TX 75006 $70,000 - $90,000 a year -  Full-time Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $70,000 - $90,000 a year Job Type Full-time Job Summary: We are looking for an Embedded Software Engineer with a shared passion for educational robotics to design, develop and support software solutions. The embedded software engineer will work with the software team to design and build embedded systems to run and control our robotics hardware. The primary focus will be systems on STM32 using the STM32CubeMX ecosystem. Our software requirements span many different domains including hardware configuration, sensor interface, motor control, and more. The ideal candidate is able to build easy-to-use software and communicate complex requirements to achieve that goal. REV is committed to providing quality, low-cost educational robotics parts for STEM Education and the embedded software engineer should utilize their skills as necessary in order to support that mission. Primary Responsibilities: Build robust software to address the many challenges of robotics education Design flexible software architectures from a set of requirements Collaborate with the product development and QA teams on requirements, development, and support through a product life cycle Participate in code reviews Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering or Computer Science or equivalent experience Experience in C for embedded systems both bare metal and with RTOS such as FreeRTOS or uC/OS III Experience with STM32, STM32CubeMX is a plus Experience implementing systems with CAN, I²C, USB, and RS-485 protocols desired Must have the ability to work independently with minimal supervision Work with a flexible schedule and demonstrate effective time management REV is open to full-time remote employment for this position, but priority will be given to people who are able to work out of our Carrollton, TX office due to the collaborative nature of our product development process. Occasional travel to Carrollton will be required for full remote employees. If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

Job Responsibilities Software Engineer (Simulation & Systems Test) - Early Career Fort Worth, Texas JOB ID: 618885BR Date posted: Dec. 01, 2022 Locations: Fort Worth, Texas Description: By bringing together people that use their passion for purposeful innovation, at Lockheed Martin we keep people safe and solve the world's most complex challenges. Our people are some of the greatest minds in the industry and truly make Lockheed Martin a great place to work. With our employees as our priority, we provide diverse career opportunities designed to propel development and boost agility. Our flexible schedules, competitive pay, and comprehensive benefits enable our employees to live a healthy, fulfilling life at and outside of work. At Lockheed Martin, we place an emphasis on empowering our employees by fostering innovation, integrity, and exemplifying the epitome of corporate responsibility. Your Mission is Ours. Lockheed Martin Aeronautics in Fort Worth, Texas is seeking a Full Time Early Career Software Engineer. In this role, you will build analytical tools to perform in-depth analysis to dig into the 1s and 0s of the jet’s integrated performance on mass scale. Using simulators, lab test, and flight test data, you will have the opportunity to learn about what it takes to complete the pilot’s mission and get home safely. Working with pilots and other test engineers, you will support flight test missions and lab test shifts from the control room, review the data real-time and post-mission from those tests to characterize and evaluate aircraft performance in the mission to provide feedback to developers, pilots, engineers, and leadership. The successful candidate will have experience and/or knowledge of how to create data analysis tools and analytics written in Python using common software development and integration tools/practices such as Git/BitBucket and Agile. Must be a US Citizen, this position will require a government security clearance. This position is located at a facility that requires special access. Basic Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, or Data Science preferred. Proficient in Python or other programming languages. Must be a US Citizen; this position will require a government security clearance. This position is located at a facility that requires special access Desired Skills: Basic Knowledge in Git/Bit Bucket. Familiarity with Pandas. Experience building / using Tableau or other data visualization tools. Experience in automation scripting or developing automated pipelines (Extract Transform Load). Experience with Hadoop or other computing clusters for Big Data mining. Experience writing Machine Learning algorithms. Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to work in a collaborative and team-based environment Proficient with Microsoft Office Security Clearance Statement: This position requires a government security clearance, you must be a US Citizen for consideration. Clearance Level: Secret Other Important Information You Should Know Expression of Interest: By applying to this job, you are expressing interest in this position and could be considered for other career opportunities where similar skills and requirements have been identified as a match. Should this match be identified you may be contacted for this and future openings. Ability to Work Remotely: Onsite Full-time: The work associated with this position will be performed onsite at a designated Lockheed Martin facility. Schedules range from standard 40 hours over a five day work week while others may be condensed. These condensed schedules provide employees with additional time away from the office and are in addition to our Paid Time off benefits. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.
